about.title: From Oranienburg – for Oranienburg
about.header: I am 56 years old – born and raised in Oranienburg, and therefore deeply rooted in our hometown.
about.para1: Sport has shaped me above all. At the age of 8, I started boxing, and later kickboxing. Sport gave me stability, self-confidence, and strength – even in difficult times.
about.para2: For many years, I have been involved in children’s and youth work as a coach: not only teaching techniques but also passing on values such as discipline, mutual respect, and responsibility. Right after my training, I chose the path of self-employment. For over 25 years, I have been active as an entrepreneur – in the fields of real estate, personnel management, and services.
about.paraExpanded: I have built businesses, created jobs, connected people, and developed solutions where others saw problems. I can say that along this path, I have grown into a strong man and entrepreneur. A consistent stance, reliability, down-to-earth attitude, and loyalty are very important to me. I know what it means to make decisions and bear risks. As a city councilor, I have been particularly involved in urban development and construction – always with the goal of sustainably advancing Oranienburg.

text.first: You don’t decide to run for such an office on a whim – the idea has matured over years. Now is the opportunity to take responsibility, and I want to seize it.
text.second: I am very aware that the role of mayor is demanding and time-consuming. My family gives me the support, and my social environment the strength, to live up to this office.
text.quote: I stand for Oranienburg – not for one direction, but for the common path.
text.third: I am running as an independent candidate because I believe in the power of working together – in a city where the best ideas are judged not by party affiliation but by their benefit to the people. I stand for transparency and, above all, closeness to citizens: not just administering, but listening, understanding, and allowing participation. I stand for Oranienburg – with economic expertise, municipal political experience, lived commitment, and above all: a clear inner stance. My goal is a city with heart, mind, and future – a policy of openness, clarity, and cooperation.

list.first: Together instead of against each other: solutions based on impact, not party affiliation.
list.second: Transparency & citizen proximity: listen, understand, shape together.
list.third: Experience & expertise: 25+ years of entrepreneurship, city councilor (urban development & construction).
list.fourth: Reliability & values: discipline, respect, responsibility, loyalty.
list.fifth: Clear course: openness, clarity, and cooperation for a city with a future.

left.para1: I want politics to be closer to the people again. That good ideas are heard – regardless of who they come from. And that we make decisions in a way that creates tangible positive impact: for families, clubs, businesses, and those who love living here. If you have questions, suggestions, or concerns: talk to me. Together, we will shape an Oranienburg that moves into the future with heart, mind, and courage.

top.thanksForSupport: Every contribution helps to make this vision a reality – through time, ideas, recommendations, or a donation. Thank you for your support!

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: The protection of your personal data is very important to us. On this website, you will learn which data we collect and how we use it.

privacy.cookies: Our website uses cookies to analyze site usage, store your language settings, and ensure secure operation. You can disable the use of cookies in your browser, but this may limit the website's functionality.
privacy.dataProtectionRights: You have the right at any time to receive information about your stored personal data as well as to request its correction, deletion, or restriction of processing. To exercise these rights, please contact us at the address stated in the imprint.
privacy.legalBasis: The processing of your data is based on your consent (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR) and to fulfill legal obligations.
